00002 #define _DYNAMIC_ARRAY_H_

00004 #include <nds.h>
00005 
00006 #define DYNAMIC_ARRAY_SIZE 100
00007 
00021 template <class T>
00022 class WoopsiArray {
00023 public:
00024 
00028         inline WoopsiArray();
00029 
00033         inline ~WoopsiArray();
00034 
00039         inline const s32 size() const;
00040 
00045         void push_back(const T &value);
00046 
00052         void insert(const s32 index, const T &value);
00053

00099 
00100 template <class T>
00101 WoopsiArray<T>::WoopsiArray() {
00102         _size = 0;
00103         _reservedSize = DYNAMIC_ARRAY_SIZE;
00104         _data = new T[_reservedSize];
00105 }
00106 
00107 template <class T>
00108 WoopsiArray<T>::~WoopsiArray() {
00109         delete [] _data;
00110 }
00111 
00112 template <class T>
00113 const s32 WoopsiArray<T>::size() const {
00114         return _size;
00115 }
00116 
00117 template <class T>
00118 void WoopsiArray<T>::push_back(const T &value) {
00119 
00120         // Ensure the array is large enough to contain this data
00121         resize();
00122 
00123         // Add data to array
00124         _data[_size] = value;
00125 
00126         // Remember we've filled a slot
00127         _size++;
00128 }
00129 
00130 template <class T>
00131 void WoopsiArray<T>::pop_back() {
00132         if (_size >= 1) {
00133                 // We can just reduce the used size of the array, as the value
00134                 // will get overwritten automatically
00135                 _size--;
00136         }
00137 }
00138 
00139 template <class T>
00140 void WoopsiArray<T>::insert(const s32 index, const T &value) {
00141 
00142         // Bounds check
00143         if ((index >= _size) || (_size == 0)) {
00144                 push_back(value);
00145                 return;
00146         }
00147 
00148         // Ensure the array is large enough to contain this data
00149         resize();
00150 
00151         // Shift all of the data back one place to make a space for the new data
00152         for (s32 i = _size; i > index; i--) {
00153                 _data[i] = _data[i - 1];
00154         }
00155 
00156         // Add data to array
00157         _data[index] = value;
00158 
00159         // Remember we've filled a slot
00160         _size++;
00161 }
00162 
00163 template <class T>
00164 void WoopsiArray<T>::erase(const s32 index) {
00165 
00166         // Bounds check
00167         if (index >= _size) return;
00168 
00169         // Shift all of the data back one place and overwrite the value
00170         for (s32 i = index; i < _size - 1; i++) {
00171                 _data[i] = _data[i + 1];
00172         }
00173 
00174         // Remember we've removed a slot
00175         _size--;
00176 }
00177 
00178 template <class T>
00179 void WoopsiArray<T>::resize() {
00180         // Do we need to redim the array?
00181         if (_reservedSize == _size) {
00182                 
00183                 // We have filled the array, so resize it
00184 
00185                 // Create new array
00186                 u32 newSize = _reservedSize + DYNAMIC_ARRAY_SIZE;
00187                 T* newData = new T[newSize];
00188 
00189                 // Copy old array to new
00190                 for (s32 i = 0; i < _reservedSize; i++) {
00191                         newData[i] = _data[i];
00192                 }
00193 
00194                 //memcpy(newData, _data, sizeof(T) * _reservedSize);
00195 
00196                 // Delete the old array
00197                 delete [] _data;
00198 
00199                 // Update values
00200                 _data = newData;
00201                 _reservedSize = newSize;
00202         }
00203 }
00204 
00205 template <class T>
00206 T& WoopsiArray<T>::at(const s32 index) const {
00207         return _data[index];
00208 }
00209 
00210 template <class T>
00211 bool WoopsiArray<T>::empty() const {
00212         return (_size == 0);
00213 }
00214 
00215 template <class T>
00216 T& WoopsiArray<T>::operator[](const s32 index) const {
00217         return _data[index];
00218 }
00219 
00220 template <class T>
00221 void WoopsiArray<T>::clear() {
00222         // All we need to do is reset the size value
00223         _size = 0;
00224 }
